## Introduction

This document provides a brief tutorial on using the c3co package from PSCBS data.

```{r}

library(c3co)
```

## Using wrapper
In this document we use the data from \code{facets} package.
\code{Facetswrapper} function segments and saves data from \code{facets} format to c3co format.
```{r}
pathPSCBS <- system.file("extdata",package="c3co.data")
stopifnot(pathPSCBS!="")
output.dir <- R.utils::Arguments$getWritablePath("outputPSCBS")
PSCBSwrapper(pathPSCBS,output.dir=output.dir, stat="C1C2")
```

## Run c3co ##
Now, you can run c3co by using this line:
```{r, eval=TRUE, message=FALSE}
resc3co <- c3co(NULL, nb.arch=2:4,output.dir=output.dir)
```
```{r, fig.width=7, fig.height=5}
Wplot(resc3co[[2]])
```
